question: Your local council is planning to hold an election to choose members from the society but there are no young people on the council and you think that the council needs young people's views. You are thinking of standing for election.Write a letter to the head of the council. In your letter, state why you want to be elected mention why you think you would be a good candidate describe your qualities, skills, experience, interests, if any
text: I am writing this letter to express my interest to be part of the local council representing the youth community. Thus, I am delighted to nominate myself as one of the candidates as being the voice of the youth.

Please be informed that I believe I have a strong passion for significantly contributing to society. I have this idea and knowledge for the improvement and enhancement of our local areas such as sports and cleanliness program. Being a youth, the basketball tournament is one way to distance them from using drugs, and at the same time maintain their physical fitness. Moreover, I have suggestions to enhance the place such as cleaning the walking tracks and children's playground.

Furthermore, I have completed my bachelor's degree in psychology and I am currently practising in the city's private clinic. Being in this profession enables me to understand my co-youth to overcome their emotional and psychological struggles in life. I can help them to navigate changes with themselves.
I appreciated it if you could consider me. Looking forward to hearing from you.
